thread.title: Live markets: Sensex trades flat, Bhushan Steel climbs 14%
thread.title_full: Live markets: Sensex trades flat, Bhushan Steel climbs 14% - Livemint

author: Livemint
title: Live markets: Sensex trades flat, Bhushan Steel climbs 14%
text: 11:20am: The BSE Sensex erases gains to trade flat at 27,598.03, up 24.37 points, or 0.09%. 11:07am: Bhushan Steel Ltd advances sharply for a second day, gaining 14% to Rs. 75.75, after the company has won majority banker approvals to refinance its Rs.35,000 crore debt under the Reserve Bank of India’s 5/25 scheme. 11:04am: Snowman Logistics Ltd jumps 4.4% to Rs. 103.55 after the company said in a notice to BSE that it has entered into a three-year service agreement with international food services giant Compass, signaling the start of a new vertical at Snowman. Compass India is part of Compass Group Plc, a global food and support services company. 10:55am: Great Eastern Shipping Co. Ltd adds 1.7% to Rs. 346 after the company said its arm has incorporated a new wholly-owned subsidiary Greatship Oilfield Services Ltd. 10:48am: Gujarat State Fertilizers and Chemicals Ltd jumps 2.3% to Rs. 77.10 after Mint reported that the company is reviving its five-year-old plan to set up a petrochemical complex at Dahej in Gujarat at a cost of Rs. 10,000 crore. The company, which is primarily a fertilizer manufacturer, also has a prominent presence in two major specialty chemicals-caprolactum and melamine. 10:40am: RS Software India Ltd dives 20% to Rs. 153.60 after the company said its consolidated net profit fell 28.4% in the June quarter to Rs. 11.10 crore as against Rs. 15.50 crore a quarter ago. 10:32am: Granules India Ltd gains 2.9% to Rs. 83.85 after the company said in a notice to BSE that US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has removed its name from the arrears list. The company also said that all annual facility fees, as required under GDUFA (Generic Drug User Fee Amendments), was paid by the company. 10:15am: The S&P BSE Sensex is now trading higher by 53.16 points, or 0.19%, at 27,626.82. 10:10am: Monnet Ispat and Energy Ltd surges 20% to Rs. 42.75, while JSW Energy Ltd slips 0.3% to Rs. 98.80. JSW Energy signed non-binding agreement with Monnet Ispat for initiating due diligence for acquisition of the latter’s 1,050 megawatt power plant in Odisha. 10:04am: ICICI Bank Ltd rises 1.4% to Rs. 313.50. The private sector bank may sell its housing finance arm, ICICI Home Finance, to investors such as private equity funds, according to The Economic Times . 9:58am: Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals Ltd (MRPL) rises 1.4% to Rs. 74.10. According to reports, the company said that it will take over a $1 billion petrochemical plant adjacent to its refinery in Karnataka in an all-share deal. 9:53am: KEC International Ltd climbs 5.5% to Rs. 141.05 after the company said in a notice to BSE that it has got an order worth Rs. 622 crore in its transmission and distribution and cables business. 9:48am: Aditya Birla Nuvo Ltd inches up 1.4% to Rs. 1,908. The company has decided to bid for solar power projects, starting with Telangana, reports Mint . The board of the company approved participation in the bidding process for upcoming central, state and private sector solar power projects. 9:42am: Tata Consultancy Services Ltd (TCS) shares drop 1% after the company after the company announced on Thursday that its first-quarter revenue rose 6% to Rs. 25,668 crore in the June quarter from the preceding three months. In dollar terms, revenue increased by 9.3% from the year-ago period to $4.04 billion. TCS’s quarterly profit rose 6.2% to $898 million from $845 million in the year-ago period. 9:40am: Sectoral indices—BSE Metal index is the top gainer, up 0.8%, followed by consumer durables index which is up 0.7%. The BSE FMCG index is the top loser, down 0.3%. 9:38am: The Sensex is trading higher by 0.36%, or 98.92 points, at 27,672.58, while the 50-share CNX Nifty of the National Stock Exchange (NSE) is up 0.37%, or 30.50 points, to 8,359.05. 9:30am: Indian stocks snap a three-day losing streak on positive cues from the Asian markets. 9:25am: The yield on India’s 10-year benchmark bond is trading flat at 7.798%. 9:20am: The Indian rupee strengthens to 63.33 per dollarcompared with its previous close of 63.39, tracking gains in Asian currencies. Read more . 9:15am: The euro strengthens to $1.1091 from $1.1065 in the previous global trading session. The dollar rises to 122.01 yen from 121.71 yen. 9:10am: Benchmark US crude rises 29 cents to $53.07 a barrel in electronic trading on the New York Mercantile Exchange. Brent crude inches up 36 cents to $58.97 per barrel in London. 9:05am: China’s Shanghai Composite Index jumps 6.6% to 3,954.83. The index is up 1.1% from one week earlier. Gains in other markets are moderate. Japan’s Nikkei 225 adds 0.4% to 19,934.43 and South Korea’s Kospi advances 0.3% to 2,033.11. Hong Kong’s Hang Seng index rises 2% to 24,883.44 while Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 gains 0.6% to 5,506.00. 9:00am: Asian stocks rise for a second day on Friday as the Greek government proposed a broad financial overhaul to its creditors and Beijing’s attempts to arrest a sharp slide in the Chinese market appeared to be working. But most Asian markets are still in the red from a week earlier. 8:55am: Wall Street closed higher on Thursday. The Standard and Poor’s 500 was up 0.2% to 2,051.31. The Dow Jones industrial average gained 0.2% to 17,548.62. The Nasdaq composite rose 0.3% to 4,922.40.
